name: BanachSpace
docs:
A Banach space is a complete normed vector space.
Every Cauchy sequence in a Banach space converges to a point in the space.

members.name: UniformlyConvex
members.docs: Whether the space is uniformly convex

name: HilbertSpace
docs:
A Hilbert space is a complete inner product space.
The inner product induces a norm that makes the space a Banach space.

members.name: HasOrthonormalBasis
members.docs: Whether the space has orthonormal basis

members.name: ScalarField
members.docs: Whether the space is real or complex

name: Norm
docs: A norm on a vector space

members.name: name
members.docs: Name or description of the norm

name: InnerProduct
docs: An inner product on a vector space

members.name: name
members.docs: Name or description of the inner product

name: FunctionSpace
docs: A function space of maps between two spaces

members.name: properties
members.docs: Properties specific to the Fréchet structure

members.name: properties
members.docs: Properties specific to the locally convex structure

name: LocallyConvexSpaceProperty
docs: Properties specific to locally convex spaces

name: Function
docs:
Function between spaces with properties
A mapping F: X → Y between two spaces X and Y that assigns to each element
x ∈ X exactly one element y ∈ Y. The function is characterized by its:
- Domain (X): The space of input values
- Codomain (Y): The space of possible output values
- Properties: Mathematical characteristics of the mapping

members.name: domain
members.docs: The domain X of the function, with its topological/metric structure

members.name: codomain
members.docs: The codomain Y of the function, with its topological/metric structure

name: FunctionPropertyVariant
docs:
Properties that can be possessed by functions
Each variant represents a distinct mathematical characteristic
that a function may or may not have

members.name: Continuity
members.docs:
Continuity: preservation of closeness between points
f is continuous at x₀ if ∀ε>0 ∃δ>0: |x-x₀|<δ ⟹ |f(x)-f(x₀)|<ε

members.name: Boundedness
members.docs:
Boundedness: existence of upper/lower bounds
∃M>0: |f(x)| ≤ M for all x in the domain

members.name: Open
members.docs:
Open mapping: maps open sets to open sets
U open in X ⟹ f(U) open in Y

members.name: Closed
members.docs:
Closed mapping: maps closed sets to closed sets
F closed in X ⟹ f(F) closed in Y

members.name: Proper
members.docs:
Proper mapping: inverse images of compact sets are compact
K compact in Y ⟹ f⁻¹(K) compact in X

members.name: Lipschitz
members.docs:
Lipschitz continuity: bounded rate of change
∃L>0: |f(x)-f(y)| ≤ L|x-y| for all x,y

members.name: Holder
members.docs:
Hölder continuity: generalized Lipschitz condition
∃C>0,α∈(0,1]: |f(x)-f(y)| ≤ C|x-y|ᵅ for all x,y

members.name: Analytic
members.docs:
Analyticity: locally representable as power series
f(x) = Σₙaₙ(x-x₀)ⁿ in some neighborhood of each point

members.name: Integrability
members.docs:
Integrability: existence of integral
∫|f| exists (in some specified sense)

members.name: Differentiability
members.docs:
Differentiability: existence of derivatives
limₕ→₀[f(x+h)-f(x)]/h exists

members.name: Measurability
members.docs:
Measurability: inverse images of measurable sets are measurable
E measurable ⟹ f⁻¹(E) measurable

members.name: Smoothness
members.docs:
Smoothness: degree of differentiability
Existence and continuity of derivatives up to some order

members.name: Monotonicity
members.docs:
Monotonicity: order preservation
x₁ ≤ x₂ ⟹ f(x₁) ≤ f(x₂) (or ≥)

members.name: Convexity
members.docs:
Convexity: midpoint property
f(tx+(1-t)y) ≤ tf(x)+(1-t)f(y) for t∈[0,1]

members.name: Periodicity
members.docs:
Periodicity: repetition pattern
∃p≠0: f(x+p) = f(x) for all x

members.name: Density
members.docs:
Density: approximation property
Closure of image contains specified set

members.name: Compactness
members.docs:
Compactness: for operators between function spaces
Maps bounded sets to relatively compact sets

name: CompactnessPropertyVariant
docs: Variants of compactness for topological spaces

members.name: Compact
members.docs:
Every open cover has a finite subcover
For any open cover {Uᵢ}ᵢ∈I, ∃ finite J⊆I: X = ⋃ᵢ∈J Uᵢ

members.name: NonCompact
members.docs:
Some open cover has no finite subcover
∃ open cover with no finite subcover

name: DensityPropertyVariant
docs:
Density property variants
Describes how a subset approximates its ambient space:
- Dense: closure equals whole space
- Various topologies: strong, weak, pointwise

members.name: Dense
members.docs:
Set is dense in specified topology
Closure equals whole space

members.name: NonDense
members.docs:
Set is not dense
Closure is proper subset

name: CoveragePropertyVariant
docs: Coverage variants describing the extent of a property

members.name: Everywhere
members.docs: Property holds without exception on X

members.name: Almost
members.docs: Property holds except on a null set N (μ(N)=0)

members.name: OnDense
members.docs: Property holds on a dense subset D ⊆ X

members.name: OnOpen
members.docs: Property holds on an open set U ⊆ X

members.name: OnClosed
members.docs: Property holds on a closed set F ⊆ X

name: LocalityPropertyVariant
docs: Locality variants describing where a property holds

members.name: Everywhere
members.docs: Property holds on the entire space X

members.name: OnNeighborhood
members.docs: Property holds in some open neighborhood U of each point

members.name: AtPoint
members.docs: Property holds at a specific point x₀

members.name: OnDense
members.docs: Property holds on a dense subset D ⊆ X

members.name: OnCompact
members.docs: Property holds on compact subsets K ⊆ X

members.name: Periodic
members.docs: Strictly periodic: f(x+p)=f(x) for some p≠0

members.name: QuasiPeriodic
members.docs: Almost periodic: f(x+pₙ)→f(x) for some sequence pₙ

name: ConvexityPropertyVariant
docs:
Convexity property variants
A function f is convex if:
- f(tx + (1-t)y) ≤ tf(x) + (1-t)f(y) for t∈[0,1]
Concave functions satisfy the reverse inequality

name: StrengthPropertyVariant
docs: Strength variants describing how strongly a property holds

members.name: Strong
members.docs: Property holds in the strongest possible sense

members.name: Weak
members.docs: Property holds in a weaker topology/sense

members.name: Essential
members.docs: Property holds up to equivalence class

name: MonotonicityPropertyVariant
docs:
Monotonicity property variants
Describes order-preserving or order-reversing behavior:
- Increasing: x₁ < x₂ ⟹ f(x₁) ≤ f(x₂)
- Strictly increasing: x₁ < x₂ ⟹ f(x₁) < f(x₂)
- Decreasing: analogous with reversed inequalities

members.name: Monotonic
members.docs:
Function preserves or reverses order
x₁ ≤ x₂ ⟹ f(x₁) ≤ f(x₂) (or ≥)

members.name: NonMonotonic
members.docs:
Function neither preserves nor reverses order
∃x₁<x₂: f(x₁)>f(x₂) and ∃y₁<y₂: f(y₁)<f(y₂)

members.name: StrictlyIncreasing
members.docs: Strictly increasing: x₁ < x₂ ⟹ f(x₁) < f(x₂)

members.name: StrictlyDecreasing
members.docs: Strictly decreasing: x₁ < x₂ ⟹ f(x₁) > f(x₂)

name: SmoothnessPropertyVariant
docs:
Smoothness property variants
Describes the regularity/differentiability class of a function:
- C^k: k times continuously differentiable
- C^∞: infinitely differentiable
- Analytic: locally representable as power series
- Gevrey: intermediate between C^∞ and analytic

members.name: Smooth
members.docs:
Function has specified smoothness class
All derivatives up to specified order exist and are continuous

members.name: NonSmooth
members.docs:
Function lacks required smoothness
Some derivative fails to exist or be continuous

name: SmoothnessClassVariant
docs: Classes of smoothness in differential geometry/analysis

members.name: Ck
members.docs:
k times continuously differentiable
f⁽ⁿ⁾ exists and is continuous for n ≤ k

members.name: CInfinity
members.docs:
Infinitely differentiable
f⁽ⁿ⁾ exists and is continuous for all n

members.name: RealAnalytic
members.docs:
Real analytic function
Locally equals its Taylor series

members.name: Gevrey
members.docs:
Gevrey class function
Derivatives bounded by |f⁽ⁿ⁾| ≤ C·M^n·(n!)^s

name: MeasurabilityPropertyVariant
docs: Variants of measurability for sets and functions

members.name: Measurable
members.docs:
Set/function is measurable
For functions: f⁻¹(E) measurable for all measurable E

members.name: NonMeasurable
members.docs:
Set/function is not measurable
∃ measurable E: f⁻¹(E) not measurable

name: MeasurableProperty
docs:
Measurability property for sets and functions
For sets: belonging to a σ-algebra
For functions: inverse images of measurable sets are measurable
Key aspects:
- Borel measurability: inverse images of open sets are measurable
- Lebesgue measurability: inverse images of null sets are measurable

name: MeasureTypePropertyVariant
docs: Types of measures in measure theory

members.name: Borel
members.docs:
Generated by open sets
σ-algebra generated by topology

members.name: Lebesgue
members.docs:
Complete measure
E⊆N, μ(N)=0 ⟹ E is measurable

name: DifferentiabilityPropertyVariant
docs:
Differentiability property variants
Describes existence and properties of derivatives:
- Classical derivatives: limits of difference quotients
- Weak derivatives: integration by parts formula
- Distributional derivatives: action on test functions

members.name: NonDifferentiable
members.docs:
Function is not differentiable
Limit of difference quotient doesn't exist

members.name: Infinite
members.docs:
All derivatives exist
f⁽ⁿ⁾ exists for all n

members.name: Distribution
members.docs:
Distributional derivative
∫f·φ' = -∫f'·φ for test functions φ

members.name: Integrable
members.docs:
Function is integrable in some sense
∫|f| exists (in specified sense)

members.name: NonIntegrable
members.docs:
Function is not integrable
∫|f| does not exist or is infinite

name: IntegrableProperty
docs:
Integrability property for functions
Describes how a function can be integrated:
- Riemann: limits of sums over partitions
- Lebesgue: limits of simple function approximations
- Improper: limits of proper integrals

members.name: Analytic
members.docs:
Locally representable as power series
f(x) = Σₙaₙ(x-x₀)ⁿ in some neighborhood

members.name: Lipschitz
members.docs:
Satisfies Lipschitz condition
∃L>0: |f(x)-f(y)| ≤ L|x-y| for all x,y

members.name: Proper
members.docs:
Inverse images of compact sets are compact
K compact in Y ⟹ f⁻¹(K) compact in X

name: OpenPropertyVariant
docs: Basic property variants for functions and spaces

members.name: Open
members.docs:
Maps open sets to open sets
U open in X ⟹ f(U) open in Y

members.name: Closed
members.docs:
Maps closed sets to closed sets
F closed in X ⟹ f(F) closed in Y

name: ContinuityPropertyVariant
docs: Continuity property variants with precise mathematical definitions

members.name: Discontinuous
members.docs:
Function has points where limit doesn't exist or match value
∃x₀: limₓ→ₓ₀ f(x) ≠ f(x₀) or doesn't exist

members.name: Locality
members.docs: Where the continuity holds (globally, locally, etc.)

members.name: Coverage
members.docs: Extent of continuity (everywhere, almost everywhere, etc.)

members.name: Essential
members.docs: Cannot be made continuous by redefining at point

members.name: Removable
members.docs: Can be made continuous by redefining at point

members.name: Jump
members.docs: Left and right limits exist but differ

name: DomainType
docs: Represents the domain type for functions

members.name:
VectorSpace(Box<DomainType>), // field type
    MatrixSpace
Exp
Log
Polynomial
RationalFunction

name: AnalyticBoundednessPropertyVariant
docs: Variants of boundedness for analytic functions

members.name: Bounded
members.docs:
Function has upper/lower bounds
∃M>0: |f(x)| ≤ M for all x

name: AnalyticContinuityPropertyVariant
docs: Variants of continuity for analytic functions

members.name: Discontinuous
members.docs:
Function has discontinuities
∃x₀: limₓ→ₓ₀ f(x) ≠ f(x₀) or doesn't exist

members.name: PositiveMeasure
members.docs: Property holds on a set of positive measure

members.name: Residual
members.docs: Property holds on a residual set

name: Sequence
docs:
Sequence in a space with properties
An ordered list of elements (xₙ)ₙ∈ℕ from a space X, where each element
is indexed by a natural number. Can be viewed as a function ℕ → X.

members.name: space
members.docs: The space X containing the sequence elements, with its structure

name: SequenceProperty
docs: Properties that can be possessed by sequences

members.name: Convergence
members.docs:
Convergence: existence of a limit
∃L: ∀ε>0 ∃N: n>N ⟹ |xₙ-L|<ε

members.name: Boundedness
members.docs:
Boundedness: existence of bounds
∃M>0: |xₙ| ≤ M for all n

members.name: Monotonic
members.docs:
Monotonicity: order relation between terms
xₙ ≤ xₙ₊₁ (or ≥) for all n

members.name: Continuity
members.docs:
Continuity: existence of a limit
limₙ→∞ xₙ exists and is finite

members.name: Monotonic
members.docs:
Preserves or reverses order
x₁ ≤ x₂ ⟹ f(x₁) ≤ f(x₂) (or ≥)

members.name: NonMonotonic
members.docs:
Function neither preserves nor reverses order
∃x₁<x₂: f(x₁)>f(x₂) and ∃y₁<y₂: f(y₁)<f(y₂)

members.name: Bounded
members.docs:
Sequence has upper/lower bounds
∃M>0: |xₙ| ≤ M for all n

members.name: Continuous
members.docs:
Sequence preserves limits
limₙ→∞ xₙ exists and is finite

members.name: Discontinuous
members.docs:
Sequence has discontinuities
limₙ→∞ xₙ does not exist or is infinite

members.name: Eventually
members.docs: Property holds for terms after some N

members.name: Frequently
members.docs: Property holds for infinitely many terms

members.name: CoFinitely
members.docs: Property holds for all but finitely many terms

members.name: ArithmeticProgression
members.docs: Property holds for terms in arithmetic progression

members.name: GeometricProgression
members.docs: Property holds for terms in geometric progression

name: ConvergencePropertyVariant
docs: Convergence property variants with precise definitions

members.name: Oscillating
members.docs:
Sequence/series neither converges nor diverges
No limit exists but sequence is bounded
